questions.question_text: Why would a developer compare a current version of code to a previous version?

choices.A: to provide the single source of truth
choices.C: to track who made a change

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer: C. Cisco Intersight

Explanation:

Cisco Intersight is a cloud-based SaaS and on-premises hybrid management platform designed for data center infrastructure management. It supports third-party integrations with tools such as VMware, ServiceNow, Ansible, Terraform, and other automation/orchestration platforms. Intersight provides intelligent automation, monitoring, and analytics for modern data centers.

Why not the other options?
 • A. Cisco DNA Center → Used for enterprise network automation, primarily for campus and branch networks, not data centers.
 • B. Cisco UCS Manager → Manages only Cisco UCS servers within a single domain and does not provide third-party integrations.
 • D. Cisco UCS Director → An older orchestration tool for UCS and HyperFlex, but Intersight has replaced it as the modern solution for managing data center infrastructure with third-party integrations.

Selected Answer: D
Provided answer is correct

Selected Answer: C
I´d selected C based on Woonesuf and Cisco comment:

"Cisco Intersight infrastructure services include the deployment, monitoring, management, and support of your physical and virtual infrastructure...In addition, Cisco provides integrations to third-party operations tools, starting with ServiceNow, to allow customers to use their existing solutions more efficiently."

Reference: https://intersight.com/help/saas/getting_started/overview

Selected Answer: B
Cisco UCS Manager for simple infrastructure management
Cisco Intersight for cloud-based management of Cisco UCS and Cisco HyperFlex

Selected Answer: C
"Cisco Intersight infrastructure services include the deployment, monitoring, management, and support of your physical and virtual infrastructure...In addition, Cisco provides integrations to third-party operations tools, starting with ServiceNow, to allow customers to use their existing solutions more efficiently."

Reference: https://intersight.com/help/saas/getting_started/overview

questions.question_text: Which Cisco platform is used to manage data center infrastructure through third-party tools and system integrations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9110.html#name-put
If the target resource does not have a current representation and the PUT successfully creates one, then the origin server MUST inform the user agent by sending a 201 (Created) response.

C is also referencing the dogbreed with example-jukebox:dogbreed
D is using only example:dogbreed
due to syntax mismatch it cannot be D, it has to be example-jukebox, which is only present in C

Selected Answer: D
while put request can also result 201 but mostly it's POST request that results the 201

Selected Answer: C
I think it is C. Status code 201 is valid for PUT as well in case the object was not yet created, and then it was created along with this PUT request

Selected Answer: D
I think D is correct because it's the only POST request and the return code status is 201 Created, which is specific to POST operation

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which RESTCONF request results in this response?

choices.C: configuring the directory to delete files automatically
choices.D: automating deletion of all backup files every 30 days
choices.A: returning backup files that are older than 30 days
choices.B: deleting backup files that are older than 30 days
